result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Milton A Machado

records.addlTxt: Paid interpreter fees for services on 8/17/22 to David Van Den Brandt, batch 7746.

Prosecuting attorney Robin W Lee in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Milton A Machado not in court.  Attorney Luis C Cuevas in court for Milton A Machado. Victim appeared by telephone. State request a body only warrant, there is already a warrant issued, asking that warrant continue.  Atty. Cuevas in agreement, bench warrant will continue.
Per DCPS violation report, Court orders body-only bench warrant.
Error on warrant issued.  Updated warrant will be issued.
Per DCPS violation report, Court orders body-only bench warrant.
DCPS Violation Report; Court Response: Warrant Authorized
Paid interpreter fees for services on 7/27/22 to David Van Den Brandt, batch 7123.
and returned.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $2,000 (per case). $2,000 previously posted to apply. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with MEJ. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any juvenile unless supervised by a responsible adult. 
- Defendant shall not be in the Village of Waunakee. 
- Defendant must maintain full-time work.
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
Atty Cuevas requested case be set for prelim.

03:01 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Luis C Cuevas.  Trisha L Simmons appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter: David Van Den Brandt (sworn). Re: DCPS violation. Argument by counsel. Court contacted victim's father on the phone at the request of the ADA. Stmts made by victim's father. Court did not revoke bail. Court ordered defn to report to DCPS asap. Court amended bail to add condition: defn must maintain full-time work. All other conditions remain.
Preliminary hearing on August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
DCPS Violation Report; Court Response: to be address at bail hearing already set for 7-27-22
AMENDED - Luis Cuevas, appointed 7/21/2022
filed by Atty Amy Johnson

Preliminary hearing on July 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defn finds good cause to go outside of time limits, CT sets PH. Notice given to Defn in court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
OSPD report
Preliminary hearing on June 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Zoom
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Cash bond is set in the amount of $2,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with MEJ. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any juvenile unless supervised by a responsible adult. 
- Defendant shall not be in the Village of Waunakee. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 7

02:32 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Will Rice Anderson.  Kyle Olsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jim Larson interpreted. Appearance by relative of victim via Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by relative of victim.  The defendant will need an interpreter for future court appearances.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
